title: Use of "tags" attribute in packages
body:
I noticed that a few packages lately introduced the attribute `tags`, e.g. :
```python
class Cloverleaf3d(MakefilePackage):
    """Proxy Application. CloverLeaf3D is 3D version of the
       CloverLeaf mini-app. CloverLeaf is a mini-app that solves
       the compressible Euler equations on a Cartesian grid,
       using an explicit, second-order accurate method.
    """

    homepage = "http://uk-mac.github.io/CloverLeaf3D/"
    url      = "http://mantevo.org/downloads/releaseTarballs/miniapps/CloverLeaf3D/CloverLeaf3D-1.0.tar.gz"

    tags = ['proxy-app']
    ...
```
Other packages go even further, and they have a last line in their docstring providing redundant information:
```python
class Aspa(MakefilePackage):
    """A fundamental premise in ExMatEx is that scale-bridging performed in
        heterogeneous MPMD materials science simulations will place important
        demands upon the exascale ecosystem that need to be identified and
        quantified.
        tags = proxy-app
    """
    tags = ['proxy-app']
    ...
```
In #4774 `tags` is only in the docstring (no attribute), and it uses a colon as a separator.

I would like to start a discussion on this, because I think we should decide how to tag packages before introducing multiple inconsistent ways of doing it. Also, in case none of the above is tied to a query mechanism, I think we should also decide which use we want to make of this information (e.g. where it can be used to filter a query, and what should be the result).
